title: Very Helpful and Kind
body: I was worried about my treatment today but had no reason to be, the staff was lovely and reassuring. Would definitely recommend. Thank you

title: Very Unhappy
body: On 2nd January at 11.45 I had an appointment with the Consultant at the Chest Clinic to find out the results of a breathing tests I had in December.  I asked about the results and the Consultant didn’t have them so I had to wait till they could find them.  When I did get the results, it was not good news and I was knocked for six by what the consultant told me, but there was no explanation about it, it was like I just didn’t matter.  Told I would be referred to a clinic and Goodbye.  I have met some lovely people at King George Hospital but this Consultant needs to learn that people have feelings.  At times like this the last thing you want is for someone speaking down at you, with no consideration of the way you are feeling.  When I left this appointment I just broke down and cried.  I hadn’t a clue what it all meant. I had to book an appointment for the next day with the nurse at my GP’s for someone to speak to about it.  I am sure Private Patients are not spoken to this way.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great care and very thorough.
body: Used 111 first, then to A&E. Triaged by a very kind caring nurse. Not a long wait for my bloods to be taken and ecg by a nurse with a great sense of humour. Then X-ray with a truly great radiographer where we had funny time having chest X-ray in 2 halves as too wide. Then to doctor who was so thorough checking everything. So reassuring and as I suffer badly with depression and anxiety I felt at ease and I believed and trusted him. The best comment was that they will always welcome me back if I need to. Even though they were busy, everyone involved was fantastic. Thank you all! Date of visit January 2020

title: EFFICIENT CLINIC
body:
I attended the One Stop Breast Clinic on 18th December, having been referred by my GP the previous week. I had found a lump which on examination appeared to be a skin cyst, and which was confirmed by mammogram and scan.  A busy but well run clinic with friendly staff on all levels.  Fortunately I do not need any further treatment, but send thanks to all, from the friendly reception ladies through to the Consultant and mammogram/scan technicians. The evening time slot was also a great help, as parking can be very difficult, but it fell between the possible end of afternoon visiting and before the evening ones started.

Gilly C.

readBy.name: Pennine Acute Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Not good enough
body:
We called 111 7 hours ago to be promised a call back regarding an issue from the doctor on call. We got a call a few hours later, approx 3hrs in, to apologise for the delay as the Doctors are running behind schedule we will call you back. It is now 1am. And my partner is in pain but not life threatening. We needed antibiotics cause we know what needs treating is minor but is being left to get worse. And is now causing severe discomfort. We cant get a doctors appointment as its the weekend or even a response from 111.

I am not angry at the staff i know they work hard and there is not enough of them. But frustrated with the service. This is poor. We have been waiting for hours and have not gone to a&e because of this because we are expecting a call. Shambolic.

title: Urgent care!
body:
Attended this hospital on the advice of 111... well not only is it filthy with gels empty - some 4 hours later still waiting to see a Dr... 
11 patients at 10.30 - 2 Dr - 11pm - 1 dr - and still 4 patients 4 hours later ... seriously and we wonder why privatisation is threatened

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: No call back
body: My mom was in really bad pain through the whole weekend, it got so bad that we called 111. We have been told that someone will call us back within an hour as she’s in bad state. It’s beef over two hours now and no call back! We can’t go to emergency as we don’t have a car and the closest emergency department is 20 miles away, it’s too late for public transport as well. This is horrible to just leave people like this!

title: Have to wait 4 weeks for an appointment.
body: I have no issue with the doctors or staff themselves as they will always assist you. But having to wait 4 weeks to see a doctor is absolutely ridiculous. I try to make appointments outside of work time but you have not got a chance to get one. So when one is available you take it, which in turn affects your employer.

title: exelent dental care
body:
having dental pain is nasty and suffering for nearly 2 years and having several appintments at other hopitals over the past year and every time I would go to these appointments I would be in one of my pain free moments and would go on to a waiting list due to the length of these list I was sent to Ipswich hospital this 19 nov 2019 they also said at this that if all my test were ok they had space for my sugery on the 28 nov 2019 and true to there word I went in on the 28 and had my 5 problem teeth out all the staff there were very frieidly I arrived at the hospital and was looking at the map to find out where to go and within moments a nurse had stop ask if I needed help and gave me direction I got to the ward where all the staff were very friendly and kept me fully informed as to what was going on bearing in mind I am over 50years old and have never been in hospital before and was very nervious the team of doctors and nurses that treated and cared for me that day were fantastic 
 other than a few days of mild discomfort after the surgery I have been pain free since I can not thank the team enough for there efforts.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great care f2f ii
body: I had my my gallbladder removed and received great care from my consultant and the staff on the day case ward it was my second operation and it was put on hold for a while as my other operation on my lung took priority but my consultant took great care of me and informed me of what was going on at all times and I'd like to say thank you

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust
NHS Leicester City CCG

title: Very Professional Service
body: I visited the A&E department and found all staff to be helpful and very professional. It is reassuring to be treated in a friendly manner with staff showing compassion and great knowledge in their field. To me this is a world class service and I would definitely recommend it to anyone. Thank you!

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: What is going on?
body: I telephoned 111 14 hours ago was told I’d definitely need to be seen by a doctor. I’ve had 3 people call me, all very apologetic about the time I’ve had to wait but would call me with an appointment, an appointment I’m still waiting for! My illness is something I’ve had before and is rather serious and was admitted to hospital with 6 weeks ago, where I stayed for 3 nights. I do understand how busy our nhs service is, but 14 hours?! Tomorrow I’ll just go to my nearest A&E department (42 miles away) and wait to be seen within 4 hours fingers crossed! It’s now 01.27 am

title: Shocking state of provision
body:
Advised to take adult in crisis with mental health issues to A&E by Avondale unit. Finally got them there and no worth while assessment took place. Advised that the adult was making unwise choices and that it was common for people with chronic mental health issues to carry weapons. Also, the adult was deemed coherent enough to not warrant an immediate assessment, albeit they expressed that they were hearing voices, talking to dead people and were extremely paranoid. 

Shocking to say the least! They referred for social care support to address housing issues...even when it was explained the the adult had been recently evicted twice,along with being violent, threatening harm and was at risk of doing this again!

If I had to advise anyone seeking support, I would say don't come here. It is appalling! There seems to be little support or understanding that it is more than likely the mental health that is the causal factor of their inability to cope socially.

I fear for what it might happen if people don't get the support they need!

readBy.name: Humber Teaching NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service from reception and the phlebotomist
body: I contacted the Practice to make an appointment for a blood test. the receptionist was very polite and helpful and an appointment was arranged for three days time. I was seen on that day very promptly and the friendly phlebotomist took my bloods with great skill and care. The whole procedure was excellent and I left without a bruise or any other sign that I had provided the blood samples.  Excellent!!

title: Professional service
body: Was seen early by the GP and given excellent advice. Then referred  to ESP Hub which was also excellent and prompt.

title: Long waits in A&E
body:
I recently attended A&E with an elderly relative. She waited >4 hours in the corridor before being seen by a Nurse or Doctor.  As a HCP myself, I have some observations.
The ambulance crews were kind, expert and I think were making a huge (clinical) contribution to the A&E service.
Your staff were calm, polite, always introduced themselves and listened to concerns.
The patients waiting to be seen, whether on trolleys or seated (there were many waiting many hours) were calm and uncomplaining, seemingly without expectation that things could be better.
We had waited hours at home already, waiting for a HCP to assess and give advice so that we could manage her illness at home, but ended up in the A&E corridor because no one could visit her at home.  After a total >12 hours waiting a preventable admission became inevitable. Discharge was delayed because of home care needs, which had not been an issue at the start of the illness.  I believe the problem was not lack of beds or lack of clinical expertise, but lack of TIMELY clinical assessment and appropriate management.  The pattern of repeated staff shortages in vital areas compounded the clinical and social problem, only increasing the burden on the NHS in the end.
Your staff in their calmness appeared accepting of a low standard of care (no enquiry or monitoring of fluid intake in a vulnerable person, no attention to the risk of poor skin integrity in a patient unable to move for hours on a trolley).
The use of AHPs for routine observations, ECG and phlebotomy was interesting - efficient for all except those who might need additional or no investigations.  Of course there may well have been background conversations we were not aware of...
At no time were either my relative or I given any information on timeframe or process.  We were still expecting a decision for discharge home until seen by the doctor late at night (12+ hours after the initial phone call asking for help was greeted with the assurance a doctor would visit her at home soon).
I look forward to hearing how my concerns can be addressed to optimise the patient journey for your future patients. A short quality improvement project with frequent PDSA cycles may be a way forward.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Helpful friendly efficient surgery
body: Friary surgery has taken great care of my parents since they were transferred following the closure of their Plymstock surgery. Nurses, paramedic, GPs and reception staff are friendly, efficient, effective and go the extra mile for their patients. Thank you for providing excellent patient care

title: Very good service friendly staff
body: My wife attended A/E on the day after boxing day, the service was really good, the staff friendly and helpful. she was then admitted to ward 30, again really good service and the staff were great. THANKYOU!!!

title: good reception staff
body: The receptionist has gone out of her way on two difference situation  on different days with a smile on her face with brilliant conduct this member of staff is what a good visits is all about. also it was explained the new way to me went home used it and found it a very good way hope it carries on thumbs up for new ASKMYGP

title: Brilliant staff
body:
I was very nervous when attending gyne OPD but the staff were wonderful and reassuring.
They even chatted to my husband too.
The staff at Pinderfields should take a leaf out of their book as all the staff I met at Pontefract hospital were lovely and friendly unlike non clinical staff that I have met at Pinderfields.A friendly and welcoming receptionist buts yiy much more at ease than one who is abrupt and unwelcoming.
Well done to all the Pontefract staff in Gyne OPD, x-ray reception and ultrasound.Even the Housekeepers who gave us directions were friendly too!

readBy.name: Leeds Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: fantastic
body: I went dental hospital in agony noone in liverpool would see to me because a dentist in queens drive taken half my tooth out an lwft the other half in the service was fantastic the stafg were amazing and really helpful cannot thank them enough for the service they were so helpful and reasured me i would be ok as i was really nervous and in a lot of pain would highly recommend this dentist hospital if its an emergency fantastic staff

title: Thank goodness for the NHS
body: Our doctors acted immediately with blood tests when i had yellow jaundice. Quickly followed by a scan being organised. 3 times admitted to the hospital and still ongoing blood tests. Our doctors have never let me down ever, i do understand the phone issues when making appointments but if its not an emergency it can be done on line. The receptionist have always been helpful when i have spoken to them. Ive been at that practice all my life and so have my children, i will never change doctors.

readBy.name: NHS Sheffield ICB

title: Managed to get an appointment
body: Rang surgery on Thursdays 19th December. To my relief I was given an appointment that morning with a practitioner. I was sent to hospital for blood tests and then given antibiotics. After 4 days the antibiotics not working again rang surgery and given an appointment that morning. Changed my antibiotics and improved within a few days. Was so relieved that I was given an appointment rather then told non available or having to wait for hours in the surgery.well done Moss Grove for having availability for patients to see a doctor the same day.

title: Best GP ever
body: I have gone through 3 different GPs in the last few years in different cities. This is by the far the best one. Accessible, helpful, professional.

title: Virtually impossible to see a GP
body: It is now vitually impossible to see a GP without waiting several weeks, all that is offered are nurse appointments.  If you do get to see a GP often it's an inexperienced one.

title: Extremely unsatisfied
body:
After travelling for 3hrs to visit a friend in the  Orchards I was denied entry to the ward & refused to be allowed to even speak to my friend. No reason was given, just a refusal by the Matron, who was very rude & confrontational. Also post & letters to my friend has been not given to her or she gets them weeks later. My friend now isn't allowed to send any  correspondence. She couldn't even send out Christmas cards. 
I would not recommend this facility to any one

readBy.name: Lancashire and South Cumbria NHS Foundation Trust

author: PaulM52
title: Blood clots DVT
body:
I was experiencing a very swollen leg which was aching and stiff.  
Managed to get a quick appointment at the Doctors who quickly diagnosed DVT and potential blood clot. They arranged an emergency appointment at the AEC at the Hospital who confirmed that I did have a blood clot.  
Appropriate medical treatment was initiated.  
Very grateful to the fast response of Belgrave Medical Centre staff to what could have been a life threatening Pulmanary Embolism.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust
Plymouth University, BSc (Hons) Urgent and Emergency Care 2022

title: Great gp/nurse poor access to them
body: The waiting times for appointments are shocking. I had to wait 8 weeks for my appointments on 3 occasions this year even though my gp wanted to see me at 6 weeks. When you call you're on hold for 50 minutes easily and there are rarely many appointments on the app within 5 weeks or with my gp. It's shocking how long you're left waiting in pain, with infections or other things you need help for. Then if you need an appointment that day you're spoken to like you're being dramatic. Although I suspect this is because of the pressure on the administration team it's not helpful when you're not well and need help. It used to be a 3 week wait prior to the merger. Alot of people I know seem to have had similar experiences recently. However, when you see a gp they are very good, on the whole.

title: Great E-Consolt Facility
body: I would like to thank the Dr who helped me with medication advice to help me through the Christmas period. I found this system to be easy to use and got a very prompt response as sometimes find it difficult talking face to face. I have always found everyone at this Practice really nice and helpful thank you all.

title: Great practice
body: My personal experience with Practice is outstanding quality of care, The team provides excellent, efficient and patient centre care.l highly recommend anyone who is looking for an excellent GP practice to register with Wimbeldon Medical Practice.

title: Excellent Practice
body:
*visit took place on 5th Jan, 2020 but online review system didn't recognise the year so had to enter 2019*

I'm very impressed with Estuary View Medical Centre. 

Although I'm no longer a resident in Kent, I became unwell visiting family over the christmas period and I attended the walk-in clinic today (sunday). The receptionist was friendly, polite and helpful. I was seen within the hour despite there being a high volume of people waiting and the nurse was very pleasant and thorough in his assessment and treatment. 

My mother also came here last year to have her cataracts done and was very impressed with the standard of care. Thank you to a professional, helpful, caring team of practitioners - an asset to the NHS.

title: Fantastic emergency care
body:
My husband was admitted just before Xmas as an emergency and very quickly had to undergo surgery to remove a mass in his colon.  I would like to thank everyone involved in his care; the lovely calm lady on the 999 call, the Paramedics who attended the call in exceptionally quick time, the staff in A&E, all involved in the actual operation and to the nursing staff in Surgical High Care and E3.  
I went home each night knowing he was in good hands, which helped me deal with everything that was happening.  
Everyone was very professional and caring and I'm very grateful that a CT Scan was done so quickly otherwise the mass may easily have gone undetected.
I think all your staff do an amazing job in a very difficult profession.

readBy.name: Portsmouth Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Clueless about endometriosis
body: I had already been diagnosed with severe endometriosis when I experienced a ruptured large ovarian endometrioma. This is extremely painful - like a burst appendix and worse than childbirth. There are also risks of complications. I had nausea, a fever, could hardly move. The person on reception smirked at me. The triage nurse I eventually saw shouted at me for not having taken an ibuprofen (pointless with this level of pain). After hours waiting in agony on a hard plastic chair, while people with minor injuries were treated and left, my blood test results came back and showed inflammation and only at this point was I actually believed. An apologetic nurse took me to a bed and I saw a doctor. The doctor had never heard of an endometrioma before. He seemed to think it was just period pain and initially told me to have an ibuprofen and go home. I had to explain to him what an endometrioma was, what happens when it ruptures, that I needed a scan and that I needed to see a gynaecologist. A while later I had a CT scan. Nobody checked on me for hours longer. Eventually a gynaecologist confirmed the scan showed I had a ruptured cyst, apologised profusely for the fact that I'd just been ignored for hours, and admitted me to the gynaecology ward. I was then finally (after about 6 hours) given appropriate (opiate) pain medication and my haemoglobin levels (which had dropped) were monitored. The consultant said I would need surgery. Fortunately, I had expert endometriosis surgery booked in a few days later (not in Sussex as there are no accredited endometriosis specialists here at all), so I was kept in for pain meds and monitoring for a few days instead. 5% of the population suffer from endometriosis. It's not rare. It's one of the most painful conditions there is, and it can have serious complications. I had endometriosis in my ovaries, bowel, ureters and it had fused all of my pelvic organs together. The endometriosis specialist informed me I was at risk of ovarian torsion, bowel obstruction or perforation, hydronephrosis and sepsis. I had been to the same A&E with the same symptoms year before and was told it was "probably wind" -  yet shortly after that a large ovarian cyst was found on a CT scan. I know A&E is overstretched. But that is even more reason to triage effectively. And it doesn't cost anything to treat patients with respect rather than open suspicion and hostility. If I hadn't been knowledgeable about my condition, and able to advocate for myself even while in intense pain, then I might have been left without appropriate medical care at all. Sadly this is typical of the medical profession's current attitudes towards endometriosis and other conditions that affect women. Have some unconscious bias training, Brighton A&E, and do better.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Resilience and supportive organisation
body: Under the current exhausting pressures of the NHS systems and processes I am totally in awe of the efforts of some of the staff at this practice in ensuring that I feel like a valued individual, ensuring that I am treated respectfully and professionally at all times.

readBy.name: NHS Bristol, North Somerset and South Gloucestershire CCG

title: Smoking
body:
Critical care staff amazing, Hero's 
Been to the hospital every day for 5 weeks now

My complaint is about smoking outside the front of the hospital. They gather near the parking ticket machines because it is sheltered why is this allowed? security should be moving people on who are smoking outside the front doors can they not be provided with a shelter away from the front of the hospital. Not only is it a health hazard the cigarette butts are all over tue floor and the ash trays on top of the bins are overflowing

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Off hand manner
body:
I called the surgery mid morning on Friday 3 rd of January.
The call was answered with a curt can i help, no greeting, I questioned is this the station practice, to which the receptionist tutted and said again can I help in a very bored manner.
I started to explain my medication was not available at the chemist only to be interrupted and told the pharmacist was not here today call back on Monday.
I asked if I  could speak to a doctor about it to be told rudely, no.
I suggest this receptionist is given training in how to answer the phone or finds a more suitable occupation, I was shocked.
I am not providing my details as this receptionist will then know who I am and where I live, Thank you.

title: Excellent surgery
body: Really helpful and friendly staff. Knowledgeable and professional doctors. Every visit got myself and my children had been very helpful.

title: Highly recommended
body: I am unable to fault this Hospital at Shrewsbury. Highly professional, considerate, most caring in all departments.

readBy.name: Nuffield Health

title: Efficient treatment and care
body:
Following a fall and after 999 call was ambulanced to a&e at Southampton General. Immediately relieved of agonising pain, prayed etc and transferred to Trauma 2 in F1 orthopedics as I had fractured my upper femur. The next day I had a full hip replacement. Nursing staff were very busy but I felt well cared for. After few days transferred to green bay and then transferred to Brooke Ward a stepping stone ward at the Princess Anne whilst waiting for a rehab bed in Lymington. Unfortunately that didn't materialise and on my request and I was deemed medically fit I was discharged home. Well now I have been totally forgotten. I am not happy I have not received a visit from a physiotherapist. When you think I might have had the chance to get a rehab bed with concentrated physio etc there has been nothing.
Whilst I was in Brooke Ward I was seen many days by physios who were lovely and definitely referred me to the community but where are they?

title: Great practice
body: I have been using this Practice for over 5 years and cannot recommend it enough.  All the GPs, nurses and receptionists are extremely friendly and compassionate and the quality of care is truly excellent.

title: Compassionate care
body: I had a planned caesarean section at 38 weeks because of multiple medical conditions. The whole team were amazing; in theatre the anaesthetists and ODPs took care to put us at our ease beforehand, and the whole team made it a special day rather than just an operation and medical issues. The same midwife stayed with us all day through theatre and in recovery and the labour suite afterwards, and provided invaluable reassurance and advice where needed, then peace and quiet to enjoy our new baby when he arrived. I stayed in hospital for 3 days and I am so grateful for the compassion, care and help from the midwives and assistants on the labour suite and Bonington ward. We were left to enjoy skin to skin bonding with our baby and given helpful practical advice to get breast feeding started before we left hospital. As brand new parents we really appreciated being shown how to change, dress and swaddle our baby, and we made it home in time for a magical first Christmas together as a family feeling a lot more calm than we expected!

readBy.name: Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Fantastic GP practice, I cannot thank them enough
body: I moved to this practice a few years ago and honestly have had a 1st class service each time I visit. I have an unusual parathyroid condition yet the doctor has understood it with me and really helped me. I recently had a back injury requiring referrals and morphine , I am fortunate to have private health insurance and had 2 referrals that where done on the day. I have been in the worst pain ever and have a new diagnosis which will be managed by this surgery and I am 100% confident they will do it amazingly. It's like a family atmosphere, it's a comfortable environment and exactly what a GP practice should be like. Thank you for everything you do.

title: Fantastic service
body:
Online access is great. Easy to use. Quick appointment. Great Doctor and friendly and efficient team at reception.
Thank you

title: kindness
body:
Our lovely mum was brought into A and E at 1 am late november. we were told that she had suffered a non survivable stroke. staff managed to find us a quiet corner in a hectic department so our family could start to gather. later mum was transferred to ward A10 where she would receive end of life care for the next 7 days. mum was in her own room and the ward staff allowed unrestricted visiting and put a bed up in the room so my brother and sister could stay overnight  so that mum was never alone. throughout those 7 long days and nights mum was cared for with the utmost kindness by everyone who came into contact with her. consultant s , auxiliary staff and the 
amazing nurses who gently turned, cleaned and administered the meds so that mum was comfortable, calm and  blessedly pain free. everyone had time to travel to come and say goodbye and were  made very welcome on the ward . we had a perfumed scarf on mums pillow in case she could still smell and feel comforted and my daughter drew a little picture for her.the staff taped the picture to mums pillow each time they turned her and put the scarf back near to her. these small things showed great kindness and compassion and meant a great deal  to all of us. when mum passed away we were not hurried and encouraged to spend as much time with her as needed. I thought i would find it very difficult to drive away that final night but in fact felt that mum was still in caring and kind hands and left with peace of mind. we will be forever grateful and  send our sincere thanks to all ....the paramedics, the A and E staff and the whole wonderful team on A10 .

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Stockport NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
The Stroke Association

title: Fantastic Care
body: Had my second colonoscopy by the professor, one of the best in the business.  Really quick referral, excellent facilities and friendly staff. Definitely use this hospital again if available to me.

readBy.name: Nuffield Health

title: Fantastic & helpful receptionists
body: These friendly and helpful ladies always do their best to help everyone even when extremely busy. I would recomend this practise to anyone, it is the best one I have experienced

title: Fabulous Doctor!
body: Thank you so much for the kindness and support you gave to my parents-in-law during my mother-in-law’s terminal illness dropping in to visit her even when not asked.

title: Incorrect records
body: I just discovered that the discharge report from A&E to my GP was incorrectly completed and detailed tests and treatments related to another patient ! A follow up with my GP was embarrassing as I disputed the records and alleged treatment with iv antibiotics....... I looked at previous documents and found other inconsistencies. I am concerned about the accuracy of my medical records and how this has negatively impacted my ongoing treatment. I will be asking for copies of my notes to put the record straight!

readBy.name: Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Like a war zone
body:
I visited a and e in Jan 2020 with my mother who is 97 and was not feeling too good.
We sat in fit to sit for 8 hours. I have to say the whole area was like a war zone patients everywhere. My mother had blood ecg X-ray etc done. We were told it would be a 7 hour wait to see a doctor. After 3 hours 30 mins I asked the nurse what was happening and she snapped I told you it was a 7 hour wait. I mentioned about the Government 4 hour window and she said oh that goes out the window when we are like this, However a further 10 mins passed and a doctor came to visit. Hours come and go without any contact only when you make a noise does something happen. I have been to a and e before and have had good service. Something was lacking today.
Your comments would be appreciated.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful lack of communication
body:
I got admitted here between Christmas & new year. My specialist hospital is ROH Birmingham. I'd recently had surgery but got an infection in the wound.
I repeatedly asked to be transferred as every morning the Dr said I could go home (but I couldn't as terrible pain from infected wound & canula in). I'd like to know why it took 6 days of me asking before someone took my condition seriously enough to transfer. I received emergency surgery within a few hours once i got to my specialist team. Awful, stressful time & will never set foot in the place again.

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Fabulous team, put me at ease from the minute I…
body:
I created myself a daunting experience attending Marie Stopes for a termination however they put all my worries at rest. The team here are fabulous - great positive attitude, very non judgemental and explained everything in detail. 

The stigma remains attached to this type of procedure and it is not a decision i took lightly but was the right one. The team there made me feel that way also and I was not made to feel otherwise.

On the flip side, I feel had I have been forced down this road in any way or I was not comfortable with this decision, there was ample opportunity and support to express this and be advised accordingly. 

Once again, great team- thank you for making an uncomfortable emotional journey for me, manageable and "normal".

Keep doing what you're doing. :-)

title: Knowledgeable Consultant
body: I visited the endocrinology department because I have a diagnosis of Chronic Fatigue Syndrome. The consultant was knowledgeable and supportive.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Profesionaly run
body:
I had a total knee replacement done over the new year and recieved excellent service, hospital is very well run and very clean with good a catering service. Staff are profesional and polite.
I would have no hesitation in recomending this Hospital.

title: Appointment booking
body: Always difficult to get through to book an appointment. If you start phoning at 08,00 it can be 30 minutes and 200 calls before you can get through to be told that all the appointments have gone.

title: Very unhelpful reception
body: Reception staff very unhelpful and like to assess your situation without any empathy or compassion. Rude and don't actually listen. Very dissatisfied and upset by them.

title: Great care lovely new extention
body: We went to see the miniature donkeys event at Culrose on the 19th December. We have seen the minature donkeys before at Culrose and it is such a nice day, this we also had the oppertunity to see Culrose new extention. The donkeys bring so many smiles to to residents, and their family and staff members, we love seeing them. We have always enjoyed to come to Culrose, and from our observation the the care is 1st class the staff are very good and we have only have good things to say about Culrose.

title: Friendly and Helpful
body:
Just wanted to say what a positive experience I've had with Balmore Surgery, from the reception staff and nurses to the GP's.
My GP had time for me and was very thorough  getting me the right services and checks I needed.
The online repeat prescription service is really useful and quick also.

title: No email communication
body: I went for an ADHD assessment in late June 2019. After not hearing anything for a few months I emailed adhdasdadmin@slam.nhs.uk in late September asking when I'd hear something. No response. In mid November I found a letter dated 9 October asking me to come for an appointment on 15 October. I emailed adhdasdadmin@slam.nhs.uk immediately, apologised for missing the appointment, advised I could attend an appointment from early December onwards and advised the service to only email me as it is more reliable. Still no response. Guess I'll have to start calling, right?

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: Happy experience
body:
I would like to express my experience with ENT Consultant and Surgeon from Bedford hospital which treated me and my husband with so much respect and kindness, I never witnessed!
I couldn't praise doctor enough. He gave to my husband first class treatment and I will continue to see him and pray of him and his family. It's always pleasure to see ENT Consultant. I would highly recommend doctor as he has caring, kind and friendly nature. From surgery to aftercare was a quality service. During my husband consultation he made us feel understood, comfortable, in control and safe in terms of trusting him with my husband life. 
Thank you all for the kindness you show every time we visit. We have been treated with respect and care. 
Thank you to ENT Consultant for treating us like a best friend , makes us feel like we are a part of family in that difficult time.
I wish you that you will be enough praised in all your life with blessing for you and your family for everything you are doing for others.Thank you for your beautiful hart. You will never be forgotten by us and ours family God bless!

title: Crisis team staff rude and uncaring again
body: Phoned up the crisis team Sunday to ask for them to call me back a lot has been going on for me and I'm struggling so I asked member of staff if she could call me back and she asked me my phone number which I replayed I didn't know it and that it should be on my notes and I did tell them my number the day before to that she replayed well I wasn't here yesterday I asked again could she get it off my notes to which she replayed either give me your number or you not get a phone call back.quite upset by this and her coldness towards me I made a call from someone eleses phone that I didn't want to ask but wrote my number down and called back.this time I said about the response I was getting and how I'd asked member of staff previous. Day for them to call me around 1pm he then proceeded to be arrogant and rude to me telling me I wasn't getting phone surport and was there anything elese I couldn't talk about my situation or what was happening for me noone cared how I was feeling and why and how I was struggling with situation I was in.I've been trying to help myself and have gone to recovery collage and whenever crisis team is brought up its always a negative reaction so this isnt happening just to me I think a lot of the staff need to look at getting another job cause they clearly can't be bothered to help service users maybe the manager should look at getting people in recovery to volunteer to man the crisis team phones so you can speak to someone that would care and want to surport other service users and talking to someone whom has been in similar situations or have been unwell themselves maybe the crisis phone line would improve I can only say this service and a lot of the staff disgust me and there only a. Few. Staff that care and do wanna help but its pot luck when you call I phone fearing the worst but come off phone more distressed

title: Disgraceful practice - Avoid
body: This review is actually for the 6th January 2020 but it wouldn't let me put that date in. I have had to leave rockhealth care after being a patient for 6 years. They never answer the phones but then tell you you should have rang at 8am when you finally get through nearly 2hrs later. When they do answer they are rude an unempathic. I visited 3 times in 3 months - once for blood tests that were requested by a private practitioner for my thyroid, once for a smear test and once for my annual blood tests due to a genetic condition I have that causes an increased risk in cancer. On my third visit of which was the only one related to my genetic condition I was quite bluntly accused of being a hypocondriac. The nurses words were you need to stop letting this genetic condition get to your head and had I even been diagnosed with this condition'  I  was so disgusted and upset by this comment that I changed GPs immediately. I have been diagnosed and have to have several screenings due to the fact I'm at an 80% risk of cancer and at a young age. I try my best to manage this condition but the one thing I need is a gp surgery who will take me seriously when I have symptoms. The first time I had a bad experience was when I was repeatedly told by a nurse at rock healthcare that I'm far to young to get bowel cancer and it's highly unlikely. I had to argue with her for several minutes that this isn't the case with my gene, she kept pushing her argument when she didn't even know what my condition was when I first walked in. News flash my dad was only 36 and Stephen Sutton was 18 so unfortunately no it doesn't matter that I'm young. Absolute disgrace of a surgery and shows how detrimental private healthcare services are for our NHS. I'm writing this now as I have been trying to call for my husband's results from a stool sample he sent in over a week ago. I have been unable to get through for 2hrs now when actually his results should have been ready last Tuesday but we can never get through and we know he has an infection as I have the same one from food poisoning. My new gp surgery got my sample a day later than his and I've nearly finished my antibiotics. However he's still waiting due to the complete mess that is rock healthcare. He has now just handed in his forms to change to my gp who also answered the phone within 2mins this morning for me to get a sick note. So unfortunately rock healthcare can't blame 'a sign of the times' as other gp surgery's in bury have got it right.

title: Great practice and lovely staff
body:
I was referred to CGH from GRI for an emergency stent for kidney stones. I can't fault the service or the staff.
10/10...would visit again

readBy.name: Gloucestershire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Inadequate care in A & E
body: I came in on 5 Jan 2020, in severe pain in my rib/back.  Very little was done and I had to sit in terrible pain for several hours.  I was given tramadol which helped for a while.  I did not have any scan or xrays they did bloods eventually to check for a clot on the lung, which it was not.  Despite my saying to the Dr I have severe problems with my spine that meant a disc could have bulged he insisted I could not have that problem in the area that is giving me such pain.  I was actually sent home in agony and told to go to my gp, the hospital could only offer morphine which I cannot tolerated have a bad reaction to, they did not even have oxycodone which I can have a little of said they did not have it in the department.  I feel this is a discrace and very typical of how some Drs view back problems.  I am very much in control of my pain issues and have a high pain threashold normally and this was very much out of the ordinary to have this level of agonising pain.  In fact I was taken in by ambulance.  I had an earlier visit on New Years eve with this pain and they gave me some valium just 3 2mg tablets to take over 3 days, which temporarily helped but the lovely lady doctor I saw then said to me to come back if the pain got worse which it did.  What a very variable service.  I left the hospital in agony hardly able to stand up and only walk a few yards.  I have had some very good treatment at this hospital but this was pretty grim.

author: Joanne1971
title: Lack of empathy or support
body:
I was referred to physio by the doctor and the staff member I felt was blunt, un-supportive and quite hurtful considering the amount of pain I was in and my poor mental health. Despite my sobbing with the pain, I was told basically that my issues were because I was overweight and that they couldn’t do anything so would refer me back to the doctor!  
I was left feeling so lonely, hurt both physically and mentally and totally helpless.

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Rossmav
title: Road Traffic Accident
body:
I was admitted to Musgrove A&E after being hit by a car and sustained a head injury and fractured ribs and collar bone, I felt very unwell. The treatment I had there was outstanding don’t know who treated me but they were fantastic.  
I was then transferred to the Gould ward and was there for a week, again the treatment I had was fantastic, Can you pass my sincere gratitude to the staff who treated me please.

readBy.name: Taunton and Somerset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Service
body: thanks for the timely, efficient and helpful way your staff attended to my mother Barbara who is 94.

readBy.name: East Of England Ambulance Service NHS Trust

title: Great service overall
body: I have had continuous treatment for 6 months and then followed up after my treatment. I’ve been very impressed with the service - the dermatology community outpatients service is very well organised and easily contactable. I was given text reminders before my appointments. Very happy with the service - thank you!

title: Worst Reception Staff
body: I have had worse experiences with Chapel Medical Center Reception staff. They are extremely unkind, rude with the patients and have no consideration with women who are pregnant too. It is totally and unpleasant feeling to contact these guys both on phone or directly.

title: Sandwell and City Road Hospitals
body: My mother had appointments and surgery involving both these hospitals and the staff were all very helpful, polite and professional. The Consultant was very clear on the operation he was going to do. Could not of asked for better service.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: A nightmare
body:
Despite a complaint .never  was anything I said taken on board .I had excuses speaking for staff ,refuting it .it was all on their terms with assuming and surmising patient experience. There was no communication on the night left hanging and waiting not knowing what was going on  ,attitude was negative and I was spoken to badly .after 111 service passed us over .
No concern for me a disabled carer as it compounded and made mine and my son's health worse .left scared and ill..
Told to ring back all the time which took me away from carers role and wiped me out . Disabled carers are not respected only expected to do what they want or go without care .no humanity on the night

readBy.name: East Midlands Ambulance Service

title: Fantastic Care
body: After being diagnosed with Thyroid cancer 6 years ago, the care  and follow up has been fantastic. I have been seen in clinic every 6 months to check that it hasn't recurred. On my last visit in December I was told that after my next 6 monthly visit they would look at the check ups being made yearly. I can't praise the team enough for their care and attention. Thank you.

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust
Healthwatch Tameside

title: Excellent patient care
body: I would like to thank all staff who provided quality care to a family member last week. The professionalism of all involved was spot on. The kindness, support and care, at such a difficult time was something I will always be grateful for and I cannot thank you all enough. Keep up the good work!

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Absolutely Fantastic
body:
my 91 year old mum who suffers with dementia is staying at Heathfield for 2 weeks respite.  She has been there a week & she is being extremely well looked after.  Heathfield go the extra mile, the food is outstanding & nothing is too much trouble for the staff.
They have brought out the best in my mum & she is so happy there.
Heathfield is an example of how a care home should be ran.
Karen  ( Sheila's daughter)

title: Abysmal service and terrible receptionist
body: Doctor told me to make an appointment asap after attending for a hospital X-ray. Receptionist told me there was a 5 week wait for earliest appointment, even after explaining doctors comments. I explained the level of pain I was in, and she said there is nothing she can do about it. I am now changing my doctor

title: superb
body: took a bit time to get the appointment, people who answered my call is very helpful, GP always good!!!

title: Wonderful Care
body: My mother was admitted to ward E54 for three weeks in December.  The care she received was exemplary and the nursing and medical staff were amazing! The staff were caring and efficient and obviously work very well together.  Nothing was too much trouble and they all seemed very happy working together.  I live and work overseas where healthcare is private but I have never seen such wonderful care on a hospital ward.  From the staff offering tea and coffee up to the medical staff I would like to offer a big thank you for your caring and thoughtfulness.  Having a family member in hospital over Christmas and New Year is not an easy time but you made it so much more bearable.  Wishing you all the best for 2020.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Visit 3rd Jan 2020
body: My mother was admitted by ambulance on a crazy busy day. She is extremely old and was quite poorly. She had a raft of tests done, they couldn't have been more thorough. Throughout every member of staff including those drafted in from other hospitals was patient, caring respectful and best of all good at their job. Scans xrays and blood tests and results were done swiftly efficiently by kind people. There was a long wait for a bed in a corridor but this wasnt the staffs fault. Ambulances were waiting outside and it was rammed. There were constant checks on mums welfare and ours and somehow the staff maintained good humour. I'd particularly like to praise the doctor, he explained everything and involved my mother despite her extreme deafness. The HCAs also need commending on a great "can do" attitude. One of them seemed to be constantly moving beds for 13hrs! Thanks to the whole great team

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Waste of time
body: Tried ringing every day for appointment at ACU clinic no answer ever . Now says they are closed until 27th December well it's the 6 of Jan - waste of space hospital

title: Muddled hospital
body: As I am new to the area, I visited this hospital because it was near. In every department I had to visit for a likely fracture in my hand, looked like it was in total confusion. Systems were down & therefore staff had to run to the xray dept for results, adding to the long waiting times. Nothing seemed coordinated. Waiting rooms are small & stuffy. As for having to go outside in the bitter cold to get to x-ray & the plaster room is ridiculous. When your not feeling too good this is the last thing you want. If I have a choice, I'd go back to the QE every time. I was told I may have a fracture, but I would get a plaster on anyway. Felt uneasy enough not to ask any more questions!!

title: Excellent practice
body:
I am very pleased with the surgery the Locum GP is very attentive and morning receptionist is extremely helpful and caring 
I am able to get an appointment easily for all my family  I would highly recommend best practice in the area .

title: Excellent GP surgery
body: Over the past 12 months I have been quite ill. My regular GP has been patient, friendly and reassuring. It's generally been quite easy to get an appointment with my regular GP without having to wait too long. If I have to see a different GP I'm never concerned as they have all made a clear effort to understand my situation by listening carefully and looking at my records thoroughly. The receptionists are polite, friendly and effective.

author: Sh1993
title: They cared for him so well.
body: My baby had bronchiolitis and the nurses on the ward cared for him so well! He then ended up on the high dependancy ward because of the quick reactions from the nurses. They saved his life and I cannot thank them all enough!

readBy.name: Plymouth University MNurs Nursing 2019-09
Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust

title: A good practice
body: Medical, Nursing and clerical staff very helpful and obliging. Unfortunately the pharmacy is no so helpful if you are a patient who has to used external pharmacies due to restrictive NHS dispensing rules which favour large phamacutical companies over GP surgeries.

title: Nurtured back to health physically & emotionally
body: Having spent 7 months in hospital including 2 months in ICU, Stroke ward, Lymphoma cancer ward amongst others.  Every single member of staff from nurses to cleaners have all helped in my recovery from serious ill health to which I am forever grateful.  I went home inFebruary '19 to continue my recovery from stroke at home.  Thank You to the many staff I've met during my stay including wards: 37, 33, 34, 35,36, 9 and others if missed.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: EXCELLENT CARE
body:
I was in A&E the week leading up to Xmas with cellulitis on one leg. Although the whole place was extremely busy, by the end of my short stay I felt that I had received excellent care given with the utmost professionalism and at every stage with friendliness, calmness, concern and dignity.
I had scans delivered quickly, blood tests with results within an hour and after a diagnosis, IV antibiotics as a day patient over the next few days. Astonishing care delivered at every point on my journey through A& E.
We are so lucky to have the NHS, free at the point of delivery, in every respect.
But it is the staff who make being very poorly, bearable.
All credit go to them.
A million thanks is not enough.
Thank you.

readBy.name: Healthwatch North Yorkshire
York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: SDO
title: They do a brilliant job
body:
Walked through the doors and spoke to receptionist, I was welcomed with a smile and a really friendly personality, after that I got told to sit down and I was barely waiting and got pulled in really quickly. The nurse who called my name bought me into the room and asked if I had any questions, she was really friendly and made me feel confident as well as having a brilliant personality and being really easy to talk to was also really cheery. Within 10 minutes I was all set up and ready to go with he help from the pre care nurse, went into the colonoscopy room and the doctor made me feel confident and was also friendly. The two nurses in the room as well was also friendly and all had smiles.  
When the colonoscopy was done I got some biscuits and couple cups of juice, the after care nurse was friendly to and helped me out. Want to say a thank you to all members of staff as they all had smiles on their faces and was brilliant with the way they approach you. Colonoscopy isn’t something I would like to go back to but if it happened again I would know that there’s a brilliant team there to support and also answer any questions which I have. They do a brilliant job and I was comfortable all throughout my time there.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley
Scottish Government

title: dont want to help
body:
i have been under eastglade since i was 14. the service has changed alot over the years and not for the better. im 31 now and have struggled alot with my mental health alot. i need support at the moment for my thoughts and things im doing to myself. i have not got anyone to talk to at eastglade and i asked for a care coordinator or someone to help me but because i have had them in the past and had therapy they wont give it me now just to see if it helps.
it feels like because ive been under the for a long time that now there just not willing to help and are just going to leave me with no support. there giving up on me now.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust
NHS Sheffield ICB
Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Disgusted with regime of bullying and punishment
body:
My son was recalled back into mental health care because he 'felt well' and was refusing to continue with Clozapine medication which was causing many side-effects. 
He has now been detained and had his section renewed for some 10 months against his will while doctors try to 'pressurise' him into going back onto the medication which clearly makes him feel unwell, and while they experiment with other medication options. 
Having requested Christmas leave for him with prior notice this was rejected by the Doctor during a review but family were not informed until we went to collect him on xmas day. As a result my son subsequently absconded and is now being punished simply for wanting to spend a few days with his family. This regime of granting leave and then taking it away as a punishment regime HAS to BE STOPPED
My son feels bullied, and is angry and upset by the treatment he is currently receiving from the doctor and my fear is that this may unfortunately reduce his chances of recovery. 
As a parent I am very concerned with a hospital which deliberately seems to exclude family involvement / support as we feel this is a key factor in his potential recovery.

readBy.name: North Staffordshire Combined Healthcare NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Growing old disgracefully
title: Good service by all
body: Visited Ayr hospital A & E today having had a fall and hurt my arm. Very good service by all. In particular Derek on triage....very friendly and genuinely trying to find the best route to getting people seen as quickly as possible...and Jill nurse practitioner....helpful and efficient. Arm was broken so now in plaster! Thank you to all

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran
Scottish Government

title: New patient
body: I filled in the online registration in January to become a new patient at this doctors after moving area. I was asked to bring in proof of address, which was done and the lady confirmed I was set up and would receive an email with access to book online appointments. I didn't hear anything for a month so called back and was advised that they didn't know what had happened but I would receive the email tomorrow. That was about 2 weeks ago now. I called again today and the lady I spoke to couldn't find any proof of address of that I was set up. She was extremely unhelpful and didn't seem to care that I wouldn't be able to make an appointment. I left it with asking her to remove all my details and I would join another doctors surgery!

author: biscuits
title: care my father received
body: My father was admitted to A&E, thereafter AAU where the care he received was second to none. Nurse Rachael was exceptional, put us all at ease and auxiliary Samantha was fantastic. Dr Selwyn was first class, phoned and spoke to the family in the morning put my mother at ease. He is back home now recovering well. Thanks to these people - thank you from all our hearts, you are amazing at what you do and please carry on

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

title: Refuses to respond to formal written complaints
body:
As someone who doesn't have long to live, I find the disrespect and downright hostility with which King’s treats aggrieved patients very sad indeed. 

Based on the behaviour witnessed, my perception is that staff derive gratification from ignoring letters sent special delivery as a way of snubbing patients.
I find it unacceptable – even for an unprofessional entity such as the NHS – to refuse to respond to formal written complaints repeatedly. 

No company would get away with this, but when it's the nhs there is absolutely nothing you can do and they know it.

I really cannot express how distressing I have found King’s continued refusal to respond to a very simple complaint over 6 months. 
King's is an utter disgrace to the profession.

 In time, perhaps in later life, you may come to realise how much harm your behavior causes to people like me and to yourselves. I will pray for you.

title: Wonderful Practice
body: Very helpful and caring reception. They took care of my 3 year old, when he was booked for a nurse appointment but needed a doctors appointment. They followed up by calling me the next day and offering me for more appointments. Always get an appointment when I call sharp 8 am, also find it easy it use the myGP app if I am unable to call in the morning. Wonderful surgery and up to date with all the online use.

title: Our practise
body: Extremley upset to hear our dear surgery only now open until 2pm three days a week it was hard enough getting an app with 5 days let alone 3.whilst I understand the gp shortage.why our surgery when there are 4 surgeries in sud ury.we have already lost our banks in clare next it will be our surgery where I have the last 25yrs found them extremely helpful.regards mrs d.a.ellis

author: Pandora69
title: My daughter's operation
body: The staff at the hospital were very friendly and put me and my daughter at ease before the operation. Also going to theatre the man spoke away to us and this took my daughter's mind of what was about to happen. I was very grateful to him for this. The after care was extremely brilliant as well. We are very grateful to all staff

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

title: Terrible surgery
body: Really (really) hard to get an appointment, usually a 6 week wait. That's if you are lucky enough to get through via the phone. Most of the time it's engaged, but sometimes you do get through (to the queue system). That's if you're not ringing between 12.30 and 1.30 when they disconnect the phone for lunch. Shambles of a surgery.

readBy.name: NHS Bristol, North Somerset and South Gloucestershire CCG

title: Doctors good reception staff good but few bad…
body: In whole good practise Dr's caring reception staff good apart from a two (they been there years) they ruin the whole experience so rude unhelpful go out of their way to make your experience so unpleasant it's a real shame as they destroy everyone's hard work especially the doctors who I found to be excellent not only for me but advise help with my mum who has advanced dementia I must say most of the reception staff when told of my mum's condition and my situation they could not be more helpful apart from the two I mentioned who go out of their way to make a 84 year old with dementia suffer  I'm happy to supply names and explain events to management I'm sure they have received complaints about these two from many paitents such a shame great surgery great place two people in my veiw ruin it

title: Disgusted with the lack of communication
body: I have never been so furious at the completed lack of communication thus causing stress. I was called by an "administrator" with no medical experience who was asking questions that I already made clear to the Doctor and well as the endometriosis department. Endometriosis is a delicate subject and those in touch with patients should have the basic people-person skills and not be so condescending. Absolutely disgusted.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Izola1914
title: Taking care of a stubborn patient
body:
As an NHS staff member myself I allowed my stubbornness to rule my common sense until I finally gave in a week into feeling poorly and requested an emergency GP appt.  
I very rarely go to the GP, however, when I do, I tend to see a specific GP (where possible) till a case is followed through. I had naughtily attended my regular GP on Tuesday afternoon regarding a repeat prescription for another condition while stifling my other developing symptoms thinking I was being wise and only dealing with one complaint in an appt. I attended another GP for an emergency appt on the Friday afternoon and after some checks it became apparent that I was quite a bit poorlier than I was letting on (very high temp, tachycardic and high BP). The GP was concise, calm and understanding and referred me to be reviewed at Hairmyres Hospital ASAP.  
On attendance to Hairmyres I was taken fairly quickly and triaged by Joe who repeated my observations and performed an ECG and took lots of bloods. He went out of his way to chat and joke with me and my husband and allowed me to be the patient and not a professional. Joe made a notable effort to speak to his colleagues and take me directly to the medical assessment unit without delay.  
In MAU I was greeted quickly by Dr Rachel who again had such a lovely manner and friendly demeanour and treated me as an active person in my own care. I was seen quickly at X-ray and my bloods came back to reveal early pneumonia.  
I have never been so glad that my common sense prevailed over my “aw its fine - other people are worse off” mentality and I have never been prouder to be part of an NHS who care so deeply and treat patients as sensible individuals.  
I, myself, have received feedback from this site on my own care for patients and would be delighted for all involved to be applauded for this evening. Thank you again.

readBy.name: Office of Clare Haughey, MSP for Rutherglen
NHS Lanarkshire
Scottish Government
Healthcare Improvement Scotland
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum
University of Suffolk

title: Disgust
body: I am still waiting for an outpatients appointment it should have been 6 weeks after discharge which would have been September we are now in January 2020 and still no appointment I cannot move on with anything until I have had this appointment. It is a disgusting state of affairs I e mailed the CEO but did not have a reply. My treatment as an inpatient was superb but this issue has really soured my view of Derriford

readBy.name: Plymouth University BSc Adult Nursing 2019-09
University Hospitals Plymouth NHS Trust
